channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Ford CEO Jim Farley says the secret to climbing the corporate ladder flows through this department—and Tim Cook is proof it works
item.description: The secret to CEO success isn’t knowing how to code or use AI chatbots—it’s mastering the supply chain, according to Ford’s Jim Farley.

item.title: Atlanta Fed President to Step Down in February
item.description: The departure of Raphael W. Bostic, who has served in the role since 2017, would create a new vacancy at the central bank.

item.title: China’s Green Triumph
item.description: China is equipping other countries to fight climate change. It’s a role reversal.

item.title: Jack Schlossberg, Scion of the Kennedy Family, Gives Politics a Try
item.description: As he prepares a congressional run, J.F.K.’s grandson admits, “I’m not for everybody.”

item.title: How Cisco is leaning on recruiting and upskilling staff in the AI era—instead of mass layoffs
item.description: As AI reshapes the workplace, Cisco is betting on its existing workforce instead of mass layoffs—arming them to code, innovate, and adapt.

item.title: Jeffrey Epstein Alleged in Emails That Trump Knew of His Conduct
item.description: In a message obtained by Congress, the convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein wrote that Donald J. Trump spent hours at his house with one of Mr. Epst...

item.title: Gen Z isn’t doom spending. Wasting money on flashy purchases is normal while you’re young and have nothing else to be admired for yet, expert says
item.description: “My aspiration for material stuff is the inverse of what else I have to offer the world,” The Psychology of Money author said.

item.title: The I.R.S. Tried to Stop This Tax Dodge. Scott Bessent Used It Anyway.
item.description: Like many on Wall Street, Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent used a limited partnership to avoid Medicare taxes. Unlike the others, he’s now overseeing ...

item.title: As Gen Z question the values of higher ed, CEO at this nearly $1 billion company says it’s ‘silly’ to think one degree will be enough education for life
item.description: Udemy CEO Hugo Sarrazin says the degrees vs. skills debate should be focused on “cohabitation.”

item.title: Kim Kardashian’s Skims is now worth $5 billion after a massive $225 million funding round led by Goldman Sachs
item.description: Young people are obsessed with Kim K's shapewear line. Nearly 70% of Skims' customers are Gen Z or millennials.

item.title: There’s a New Forecast for Peak Oil Demand. It’s Increasingly Cloudy.
item.description: The International Energy Agency once projected that oil and gas demand could level off by 2030. Now it’s backing off, sort of.

item.title: Pakistan’s Army Chief Is Granted Sweeping Authority Over All Military Branches
item.description: A constitutional amendment in the nuclear-armed country extends the chief’s power over all the military and brings Pakistan’s highest court under tigh...

item.title: How to Capture the Northern Lights With Just Your Smartphone
item.description: Modern cellphone cameras make it easy to capture the famously fickle Aurora Borealis.

item.title: Turkish Military Plane Crashes in Georgia, Killing 20 Troops
item.description: The Turkish defense minister said that 20 Air Force servicemen died when their military cargo plane crashed after taking off from Azerbaijan on Tuesda...

item.title: Northern Lights Illuminate Skies Above North America
item.description: The northern lights could be seen in skies as far south as Texas late Tuesday and early Wednesday after the sun emitted masses of charged particles th...
